verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, Depart, and go up hence, thou and the people which thou hast brought up out of the land of Egypt, unto the land which I sware unto Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, Unto thy seed will I give it:
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses, “Depart, go up from here, you and the people that you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, ‘I will give it to your offspring.’
verses.ct: The LORD told Moses, "Leave this place. Take the people you brought out of Egypt and head to the land I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, 'I will give this land to your descendants.'

verses.kjv: And I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
verses.web: I will send an angel before you; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
verses.ct: I will send an angel ahead of you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.

verses.kjv: Unto a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked people: lest I consume thee in the way.
verses.web: Go to a land flowing with milk and honey; but I will not go up among you, for you are a stiff-necked people, lest I consume you on the way.”
verses.ct: Go to that land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go with you myself, because you are a stubborn people, and I might destroy you along the way."

verses.kjv: And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and no man did put on him his ornaments.
verses.web: When the people heard this evil news, they mourned; and no one put on his jewelry.
verses.ct: When the people heard this terrible news, they mourned deeply. No one put on any jewelry.

verses.kjv: For the LORD had said unto Moses, Say unto the children of Israel, Ye are a stiffnecked people: I will come up into the midst of thee in a moment, and consume thee: therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee, that I may know what to do unto thee.
verses.web: LORD had said to Moses, “Tell the children of Israel, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. If I were to go up among you for one moment, I would consume you. Therefore now take off your jewelry from you, that I may know what to do to you.’ ”
verses.ct: The LORD had told Moses, "Say to the people of Israel: 'You are a stubborn people. If I traveled among you for even a moment, I would destroy you. So take off your jewelry now, and I will decide what to do with you.'"

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments by the mount Horeb.
verses.web: The children of Israel stripped themselves of their jewelry from Mount Horeb onward.
verses.ct: So from Mount Horeb onward, the people of Israel stripped off all their jewelry.

verses.kjv: And Moses took the tabernacle, and pitched it without the camp, afar off from the camp, and called it the Tabernacle of the congregation. And it came to pass, that every one which sought the LORD went out unto the tabernacle of the congregation, which was without the camp.
verses.web: Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, far away from the camp, and he called it “The Tent of Meeting.” Everyone who sought LORD went out to the Tent of Meeting, which was outside the camp.
verses.ct: Moses would take a tent and set it up far outside the camp. He called it the Tent of Meeting. Anyone who wanted to seek the LORD would go out to the Tent of Meeting, outside the camp.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Moses went out unto the tabernacle, that all the people rose up, and stood every man at his tent door, and looked after Moses, until he was gone into the tabernacle.
verses.web: When Moses went out to the Tent, all the people rose up, and stood, everyone at their tent door, and watched Moses, until he had gone into the Tent.
verses.ct: Whenever Moses walked out to the Tent, all the people would stand up. Each person stood at the entrance of their own tent and watched Moses until he disappeared inside.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as Moses entered into the tabernacle, the cloudy pillar descended, and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and the Lord talked with Moses.
verses.web: When Moses entered into the Tent, the pillar of cloud descended, stood at the door of the Tent, and LORD spoke with Moses.
verses.ct: As soon as Moses entered the Tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and hover at the entrance, and the LORD would speak with Moses.

verses.kjv: And all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand at the tabernacle door: and all the people rose up and worshipped, every man in his tent door.
verses.web: All the people saw the pillar of cloud stand at the door of the Tent, and all the people rose up and worshiped, everyone at their tent door.
verses.ct: When the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance of the Tent, they would all rise and worship, each one bowing at the door of their own tent.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses face to face, as a man speaketh unto his friend. And he turned again into the camp: but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, departed not out of the tabernacle.
verses.web: LORD spoke to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. He turned again into the camp, but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, didn’t depart from the Tent.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses face to face, the way a person talks with a friend. Afterward, Moses would return to the camp, but his young servant Joshua son of Nun stayed behind in the Tent.

verses.kjv: And Moses said unto the LORD, See, thou sayest unto me, Bring up this people: and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with me. Yet thou hast said, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.
verses.web: Moses said to LORD, “Behold, you tell me, ‘Bring up this people;’ and you haven’t let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my sight.’
verses.ct: Moses said to the LORD, "You keep telling me, 'Lead this people,' but you haven't told me who you're sending with me. Yet you've said, 'I know you by name, and you have found favor with me.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thy sight, shew me now thy way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in thy sight: and consider that this nation is thy people.
verses.web: Now therefore, if I have found favor in your sight, please show me your way, now, that I may know you, so that I may find favor in your sight; and consider that this nation is your people.”
verses.ct: So if I truly have found favor with you, please show me your ways so I can know you and continue to find favor with you. And remember — this nation is your people."

verses.kjv: And he said, My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
verses.web: He said, “My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
verses.ct: The LORD answered, "My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest."

verses.kjv: And he said unto him, If thy presence go not with me, carry us not up hence.
verses.web: Moses said to him, “If your presence doesn’t go with me, don’t carry us up from here.
verses.ct: Moses replied, "If your presence isn't going with us, then don't send us from here at all.

verses.kjv: For wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight? is it not in that thou goest with us? so shall we be separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth.
verses.web: For how would people know that I have found favor in your sight, I and your people? Isn’t it that you go with us, so that we are separated, I and your people, from all the people who are on the surface of the earth?”
verses.ct: How will anyone know that your people and I have found favor with you unless you go with us? That's what sets us apart from every other nation on the face of the earth."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Moses, I will do this thing also that thou hast spoken: for thou hast found grace in my sight, and I know thee by name.
verses.web: LORD said to Moses, “I will do this thing also that you have spoken; for you have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name.”
verses.ct: The LORD said to Moses, "I will do exactly what you've asked, because you have found favor with me, and I know you by name."

verses.kjv: And he said, I beseech thee, shew me thy glory.
verses.web: Moses said, “Please show me your glory.”
verses.ct: Then Moses said, "Please — show me your glory."

verses.kjv: And he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and I will proclaim the name of the LORD before thee; and will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will shew mercy on whom I will shew mercy.
verses.web: He said, “I will make all my goodness pass before you, and will proclaim LORD’s name before you. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.”
verses.ct: The LORD replied, "I will cause all my goodness to pass in front of you, and I will proclaim my name — the LORD — in your presence. I will be gracious to whoever I choose to be gracious to, and I will show mercy to whoever I choose to show mercy to."

verses.kjv: And he said, Thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man see me, and live.
verses.web: He said, “You cannot see my face, for man may not see me and live.”
verses.ct: But he added, "You cannot see my face, because no one can see me and live."

verses.kjv: And the LORD said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon a rock:
verses.web: LORD also said, “Behold, there is a place by me, and you shall stand on the rock.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said, "Look — there is a place near me where you can stand on a rock.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a clift of the rock, and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:
verses.web: It will happen, while my glory passes by, that I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and will cover you with my hand until I have passed by;
verses.ct: When my glory passes by, I will tuck you into a cleft in the rock and cover you with my hand until I have passed.

verses.kjv: And I will take away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
verses.web: then I will take away my hand, and you will see my back; but my face shall not be seen.”
verses.ct: Then I will take my hand away, and you will see my back. But my face must not be seen."
